data: influenza vaccine seasonal - adult (18 to 64 years of age)
influenza vaccine seasonal - adult (65 years of age and above)
0.5 mL, subcutaneous, as directed, drug form: inj
If/when Influenza season, then nurse use "Add To Phase" to place order for influenza vaccine
If/when pneumococcal vaccine is at or past 5 years, then nurse to use "Add To Phase" to place order for pneumococcal vaccine
1 mL, IM, as directed, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
1 mL, IM, as directed, order duration: 3 doses or times, drug form: inj
1 mL, IM, once, drug form: inj
2 mL, IM, as directed, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
2 mL, IM, as directed, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
2 mL, IM, once, drug form: inj
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when Vaccination series is administered, then Nurse to order anti-HBs 1 month after series completion, based on the local Hepatitis B Vaccination Algorithm for Chronic Hemodialysis Patients
Conditional Order - Nurse to Place Lab Order - One Time
If/when Anti-HBs result equal or greater than 10 IU/L, then Nurse to order anti-HBs yearly after, based on the local Hepatitis B Vaccination Algorithm for Chronic Hemodialysis Patients

If/when HBsAg negative, anti-HBs negative or Anti-HBs is less than 10 IU/L, then Nurse to order Hepatitis B vaccine (series or booster), based on the local Hepatitis B Vaccination Algorithm for Chronic Hemodialysis Patients
